subject: RE: [junit] Junit 3.8: Maven build can't resolve TestCase.fail(message)
msgSnippet: I guess you should better ask the question to the maven mailing list, but anyway, did you tried to add junit as test dependency? Gilles
messageBody:
I guess you should better ask the question to the maven mailing list, but
anyway, did you tried to add junit as test dependency?

Gilles

> -----Original Message-----
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
> dlevitt_us
> Sent: mardi 13 mars 2007 17:29
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Junit 3.8: Maven build can't resolve
> TestCase.fail(message)
>
> I have a simple library, with some testers compiled with a maven
> [2.05] pom.
>
> Unit testing is performed with JUnit 3.8.1 [fairly standard so far]
>
> When compiling/testing/running from an IDE the unit tests compile and
> run without problems.
>
> When compiling from the command line [mvn clean package] the compile
> stage of the build fails with
>
> C:\src\SearchInterface\SearchCore\src\main\java\test\ecom\search\SearchBas
> e.java:[209,12]
> cannot resolve symbol
> symbol : method fail (java.lang.String)
> location: class test.ecom.search.SearchBase
>
> SearchBase extends TestCase, and the fail(String) method has been in
> the 3.8.x libraries for some time.
>
> Could the JUnit jar posted to the maven repositories be invalid? [and
> now off to the maven mailing list...]
>
>
>
>
> Yahoo! Groups Links
>
>
>
